greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Tree of Ludic sieve: a(0) = 1, a(1) = 2; after which, a(2n) = A269379(a(n)), a(2n+1) = 2*a(n).
comment: Permutation of natural numbers obtained from the Ludic sieve. Note the indexing: Domain starts from 0, range from 1.

This sequence can be represented as a binary tree. Each left hand child is obtained by applying A269379 to the parent's contents, and each right hand child is obtained by doubling the parent's contents:
Sequence A269385 is obtained from the mirror image of the same tree.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of other permutations:
xref: Cf. A003309 (left edge of the tree).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 01 2016
